sen.j: 宇野 明霞（うの めいか、元禄11年5月20日 (旧暦)（1698年6月27日） - 延享2年 4月14日 (旧暦)（1745年5月15日））は江戸時代中期の日本の儒学者である。
sen.e: Meika UNO (June 27, 1698 - May 15, 1745) was a Japanese Confucian scholar in the middle of the Edo period.
Meika UNO (June 27, 1698 - May 15, 1745) was a Japanese Confucian scholar in the middle of the Edo period.
Meika UNO (June 27, 1698 - May 15, 1745) was a Japanese Confucian scholar in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 名前を鼎、字を士新、通称 三平。
sen.e: His name was Kanae, azana (Chinese courtesy name formerly given to adult Chinese men, which used in place of their given name in formal situations; Japanese scholars and the literati adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Shishin and popular name was Sanpei.
sen.cmt: 鼎、士新の読みについては推察です。（鼎（カナエ）の読みについてはあっていますが、他に’テイ’ともよみます。）
sen.e: His name was Kanae, his azana (Chinese courtesy name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; Japanese scholars and the literati adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Shishin, and popular name was Sanpei.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスを訂正するためazanaの前にhisを追加 whichを削除、popular の前にhisを追加しました。
sen.e: His name was Kanae, his azana (Chinese courtesy name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; Japanese scholars and the literati adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Shishin, and popular name was Sanpei.

sen.j: 宇士新と中国風に名乗った。
sen.e: He named himself in Chinese-style as U Shishin.
sen.cmt: 宇士新の読みについては推察です。

He named himself in Chinese-style as U Shishin.

sen.j: 弟の宇野士朗とともに平安二宇先生と称された。
sen.e: He and his younger brother Shiro UNO were called as Heian Ni U sensei (two U teachers in Heian).
He and his younger brother Shiro UNO were called as Heian Ni U sensei (two U teachers in Heian).
He and his younger brother Shiro UNO were called as Heian Ni U sensei (two U teachers in Heian).

sen.j: 近江国野洲（現滋賀県野洲市）に生まれたが、父 安治が嵯峨 (京都市)の豪商角倉家に仕え運漕（船で貨物を運ぶ仕事）をしており、一家で京都に移り住んだ。
sen.e: He was born in Yasu, Omi Province but his family moved to Kyoto as his father Yasuharu was serving Suminokura family, a wealthy merchant in Saga (Kyoto City), and working as Unso (a work that carries freights on a ship).

He was born in Yasu, Omi Province (present Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture) but his family moved to Kyoto as his father Yasuharu was serving Suminokura family, a wealthy merchant in Saga (Kyoto City), and working as Unso (a work that carries freights on a ship).
sen.cmt: 訳抜け： (present Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture) を追加。
sen.e: He was born in Yasu, Omi Province (present Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture) but his family moved to Kyoto as his father Yasuharu was serving Suminokura family, a wealthy merchant in Saga (Kyoto City), and working as Unso (a work that carries freights on a ship).

sen.j: 明霞は最初、木下順庵門下の向井三省に師事する。
sen.e: At first, Meika studied under Sansei MUKAI, a disciple of Junan KINOSHITA.

sen.j: しかし、入江若水を通じて古文辞学を知り、自らは病弱であったため弟の士郎を江戸に遊学させて荻生徂徠に入門させている。
sen.e: However he learnt kobunjigaku (study of ancient rhetoric school) through Jakusui IRIE and he made his younger brother Shiro to go study in Edo to become disciple of Sorai OGYU.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Meika, who learnt kobunjigaku (study of ancient rhetoric school) through Jakusui IRIE but was physically weak, sent his younger brother Shiro to Edo to study it there in pace of himself under Sorai OGYU.
sen.cmt: 訳抜け：「自らは病弱であったため」文法ミスmade his younger brother Shiro to go のため全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: However, Meika, who learnt kobunjigaku (study of ancient rhetoric school) through Jakusui IRIE but was physically weak, sent his younger brother Shiro to Edo to study it there in pace of himself under Sorai OGYU.

sen.j: 自分自身は京都に残り、大潮元皓に中国語や古文辞学を受ける。
sen.e: He remained in Kyoto and studied Chinese and kobunjigaku under Genko DAICHO.
Meika himself remained in Kyoto and studied Chinese and kobunjigaku under Genko DAICHO.
sen.cmt: 文頭のHeをMeika himselfとしました、
sen.e: Meika himself remained in Kyoto and studied Chinese and kobunjigaku under Genko DAICHO.

sen.j: 弟 士郎はわずか一年で帰京した。
sen.e: His younger brother Shiro returned to Kyoto after only a year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: His younger brother Shiro returned to Kyoto after only a year.

sen.j: これは徂徠の教育方針に納得できず、さらには古文辞学内に徂徠学を継承する者はいないと判断したからである。
sen.e: This was because he could not agree with Sorai's educational policy and moreover, he judged that there are nobody to inherit Soraigaku (study preached by Sorai) in kobunjigaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This was because Meika could not agree with Sorai's educational policy and moreover, he judged that there would be nobody to inherit Soraigaku (study preached by Sorai) in kobunjigaku.
sen.cmt: heをMeikaに書き換え主語を明確にしました。時制ミスのため、areをwould beに変えました。
sen.e: This was because Meika could not agree with Sorai's educational policy and moreover, he judged that there would be nobody to inherit Soraigaku (study preached by Sorai) in kobunjigaku.

sen.j: 特に服部南郭や平野金華に対して厳しい批判を行っている。
sen.e: Especially he criticized bitterly at Nankaku HATTORI and Kinka HIRANO.
Especially Meika bitterly criticized Nankaku HATTORI and Kinka HIRANO.
sen.cmt: heをMeikaに書き換え主語を明確にしました。 criticized bitterly at を bitterly criticized に変えました。atは不要です。
sen.e: Especially Meika bitterly criticized Nankaku HATTORI and Kinka HIRANO.

sen.j: 十数年もの間、家に籠もり古書・典籍を精読しひたすら独学した。
sen.e: Meika stayed at home for more than a decade reading Kosho (ancient book) and books carefully and devotedly studied.
Meika spent ten-odd years at home, carefully reading ancient books and documents, to devote himself to studies.
sen.cmt: 全文書き換えました。「古書」はkoshoとローマ字表記する必要はないと思われます。「古書・典籍」はancient books and documentsとしました。
sen.e: Meika spent ten-odd years at home, carefully reading ancient books and documents, to devote himself to studies.

sen.j: やがて独自の学問を樹立し徂徠と訣別し蘐園学派を激しく批判するようになる。
sen.e: In due course he established original scholarship, parting from Sorai and started to criticize bitterly at Kenengakuha (a Confucian school sect of Sorai OGYU and his disciples).
Later, he established his own field of study, parting from Sorai, and started to bitterly criticize Kenengakuha (a Confucian school sect of Sorai OGYU and his disciples).
sen.cmt: In due courseは多くの場合未来形とともに使うフレーズのように感じLaterに書き換えました。 criticize bitterly at を bitterly criticizeに書き換えました。original scholarshipを his own field of studyに書き換えました。
sen.e: Later, he established his own field of study, parting from Sorai, and started to bitterly criticize Kenengakuha (a Confucian school sect of Sorai OGYU and his disciples).

sen.j: 夭折した学者 田中大観とは学問を通じて親しく交流し、彼の碑銘を書いている。
sen.e: He had close friendship with a scholar Taikan TANAKA, who died young, through scholarship and he wrote an epitaph of Taikan.
He had close friendship with Taikan TANAKA, a scholar who died young, through scholarship and he wrote an epitaph for Taikan's grave.
sen.cmt: a scholarをwhoの前に移動しました。 文末of Taikanをfor Taikan's graveとしました。
sen.e: He had close friendship with Taikan TANAKA, a scholar who died young, through scholarship and he wrote an epitaph for Taikan's grave.

sen.j: 太宰春台は徂徠が志した政治にまったく関心を示していないとしてこの兄弟を非難している。
sen.e: Shundai DAZAI criticized Meika that Meika is not showing any interest in the politics that Sorai aimed for.
Shundai DAZAI criticized Meika as not showing any interest in the politics that Sorai sought to realize.
sen.cmt: that Meika isをasに、aimed forをsought to realizeに書き換えました。
sen.e: Shundai DAZAI criticized Meika as not showing any interest in the politics that Sorai sought to realize.

sen.j: 明霞は生涯、妻帯することはなかった。
sen.e: He remained single all his life.
